## Short Bio

Yunus Emre Tapan is a PhD Student in Political Science at Northeastern University. Emre earned his B.A. in Economics from Bogazici University and his M.Sc. in Middle East Studies from METU. His research sits at the intersection of data science and social sciences. He specializes in social network analysis and computational text analysis to study online polarization, online extremism and non-state actors with a particular focus on how they radicalize.

He is a graduate of SICSS-Helsinki in 2018 and ICPSR Summer Program in 2020 as one of the recipients of the Scholarship for Political Science Research. He is co-organizer of Summer Institute in Computational Social Science in Istanbul. He is the lead of Istanbul Twitter Develeoper Community.
